Queen Elizabeth II , 94, is the longest-reigning monarch in British history and came to the throne on her father King George VI's death on February 6, 1952. However, it wasn't until more than a year later that her ascension was formalised and she was crowned in a spectacular coronation ceremony at Westminster Abbey. Trending Queen Elizabeth II's coronation took place on June 2, 1953, and made history for several reasons.
